text:
Hello,

Usually when fetching data from a Hubdb table, i use this to check if rows exist : {% if rows|length %}

How can i check if table has no rows ?

Thanks!
You should be able to do `if not rows|length`

Has anyone had any success using the crm_property_definition or crm_property_definitions function? I am trying to get the property definition for a deal and I am getting the error
"object type `deal` does not exist"
e.g.
`{% set customer_agency_options = crm_property_definition("deal", "select_agency") %}`
Using this in exactly the same way, but for custom objects, it works as I would have expected, just not for HS Built-in objects (I tried contacts and deals, so assume it would be the same for the others.)

<@U9KA594Q3>, I am storing image links in my hubdb, in a column "Case Image"
and i am calling this column into the src="" attribute in my html. But the images are not rendering when i test the emails.

Is there anything else i should be taking into consideration when calling images from my hubdb table ? Should the column type be set as "Image" or "URL" ?

Thank you loads!
Hey <@U02J1440N13> can you try doing a `|pprint` on the column and see what fields are available

<@U9KA594Q3> When i try to call the column this way:
 {{ case_img }}
Nothing is displayed, although there is a link stored in the associated row
<@U9KA594Q3> we just needed to add an image per row to optimize experience.
